title: Add more photos on every page

requirements.text: Add additional photo content to every routed page so that each page contains at least one extra image beyond what it currently shows (e.g., a secondary banner image, a small photo grid, or a supporting image section), using the app’s existing PageHeroImage styling and generated-asset cache-busting behavior.

quotes: YES I WNT MORE PHOTO IN EVERY SINGEL PAGE

acceptanceCriteria: Each route in frontend/src/App.tsx (/, /about, /services, /contact, /appointments, /emergency, /doctor-suites, /domain-draft, /decommissioned, and the * not-found route) renders at least one additional / compared to the current implementation.
All newly-added images load from /assets/generated/... and use the existing cache-busting approach (directly via PageHeroImage or via withCacheBust for non-PageHero images).
All new images include meaningful English alt text.
Pages remain responsive on mobile and desktop; images do not overflow their containers and maintain rounded/shadow styling consistent with existing hero imagery.

requirements.text: Update the Domain Draft page so that the unauthenticated view (when login is required) also includes a photo/illustration (similar to other pages), rather than showing only text/alerts.

quotes: YES I WNT MORE PHOTO IN EVERY SINGEL PAGE

acceptanceCriteria: When not authenticated, /domain-draft includes an image component (e.g., PageHeroImage) using a generated asset and English alt text.
When authenticated, the existing hero image remains and the page also satisfies the “additional photo content” requirement.

requirements.text: Add the newly generated image files as static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and render them in the appropriate pages to increase photo presence site-wide.

quotes: YES I WNT MORE PHOTO IN EVERY SINGEL PAGE

acceptanceCriteria: All image filenames listed in imageRequirements.required exist under frontend/public/assets/generated.
Each listed new image is referenced by at least one page component.
No backend endpoints are added/changed to serve images.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or anything in frontend/src/components/ui (compose these components instead).
Keep the backend as a single Motoko actor (no additional backend services).
Store and serve images as frontend static assets (do not route images through the backend).
nonGoals: Implementing user-uploaded photos or an admin photo management CMS.
Changing routing structure or adding new routes beyond adding images to existing routes.

required: Doctors with patient in consultation room (appointments-consult-room.dim_1600x900.png)
Group portrait of doctors in corridor (doctors-portraits-collage.dim_1600x900.png)
Administrative office desk with laptop and documents (domain-admin-desk.dim_1600x900.png)
Maintenance tools and caution signage illustration (decommissioned-tools-illustration.dim_1200x600.png)
Map/compass style illustration for navigation help (notfound-navigation-illustration.dim_1200x600.png)
